title: Integrate with Zoom for SAM
content:
This page describes how to configure an integration with Zoom Cloud to import user entitlement data. This is part of the SaaS product setup in SAM.

Configure Zoom application and get Client ID and Client Secret

  1. Log in to Zoom App Marketplace. 
  2. In the upper right corner, click Manage before your profile. 
  3. Choose Develop > Build App and agree to the API license and terms of use.
  4. Select General App and click Create.
  5. In the Basic Information section, select Admin-managed to allow account admins to add manage the app, and click Save.
  6. In App Credentials, note down the values of Client ID and Client Secret for later endpoint configuration in Service Management. See the Create an endpoint section below. 
  7. Specify the OAuth Redirect URL field. You can get the value during endpoint configuration in Service Management.
  8. Go to the Scopes section, click Add scopes, and enter list_users in the search box. Select View users with the user:read:list_users:admin permission and click Done.
  9. In the Add your app section, click Add App Now.

Prepare an integration user

Before setting up the integration, prepare an integration user.

Set up the Zoom integration in Service Management

To set up the Zoom integration for data import, perform the following steps.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as the integration administrator.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Zoom), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  5. Click Configure and complete the following fields.
    Field Value
    General configuration
    Agent Select Agentless for a direct connection to the Zoom API.
    Authentication type Select OAuth 2.0.
    Protocol Select https.
    Base URL Enter https://api.zoom.us.
    Certificate type (Optional) Select X.509.
    Certificate format (Optional) Select PEM.
    Server certificate

    (Optional)

    Open the root CA certificate file of the Zoom system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step.

    The certificate content must resemble the following:

    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----

    

    -----END CERTIFICATE-----
    Enable email notification for token expiration Clear this checkbox.
    Get token configuration
    Grant Type Select Authorization Code.
    Client ID Enter the client ID obtained during the Zoom application configuration.
    Client Secret Enter the client secret obtained during the Zoom application configuration.
    Authorization URL Enter https://zoom.us/oauth/authorize
    Redirect URL This field is automatically fulfilled.
    Token URL Enter https://zoom.us/oauth/token.
    Scope Enter user:read:list_users:admin.

    State

    		 Enter state.
    Send client Id and secret Select In body.

    Content-Type

    		 Select application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
  6. Click Get token and then complete the login and consent process. If your endpoint configuration is correct, you will see the Available status in the Token status section after the process is finished.
  7. Click Save.

Create an integration

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and click Active to activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Zoom as the connector, select the Zoom endpoint you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add the scenario

Perform the following steps to add a scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario.
  3. In the Template field, select SAM - Import Zoom user entitlement.
    • Using the out-of-the-box template simplifies integration configuration compared to starting from scratch. If you choose not to use this option, you'll need to manually build your logic from a blank page.
    • You can update the APIVersion, UserType, and PlanTypeMapping keys in the template based on your business requirements. 

      The default value of UserType is 2, indicating that the user is assigned a "Licensed" plan type. This means the template is specifically designed for importing users with licensed plans.

  4. Click Save to add the scenario. 

Next steps

Complete the remaining steps of the SaaS product configuration process:

  • Create and configure the Zoom product in SAM
  • Create license metrics (if necessary)
  • Create licenses for services included in Zoom (if necessary)
  • Verify the Zoom integration
  • Verify the details of the license models for Zoom services
  • Schedule the periodic triggering of the integration
